   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: %%% Purpose : Test the timer module a simpler/faster test than timer_SUITE
   21: 
   22: -module(timer_simple_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% This test suite matches on opaque tref() return values from the *_after
   25: %% and *_interval functions, namely {instant, _}, {send_local, _}, {once, _}
   26: %% and {interval, _}.
   27: %% If the implementation changes, the test suite has to be changed accordingly.
   28: 
   29: %% external
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   31:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   32:          init_per_testcase/2,
   33:          apply_after1/1,
   34:          apply_after2/1,
   35:          apply_after3/1,
   36:          apply_after4/1,
   37:          apply_after_invalid_args/1,
   38:          send_after1/1,
   39:          send_after2/1,
   40:          send_after3/1,
   41:          send_after4/1,
   42:          send_after5/1,
   43:          send_after6/1,
   44:          send_after7/1,
   45:          send_after_invalid_args/1,
   46:          exit_after1/1,
   47:          exit_after2/1,
   48:          exit_after3/1,
   49:          exit_after4/1,
   50:          kill_after1/1,
   51:          kill_after2/1,
   52:          kill_after3/1,
   53:          apply_interval1/1,
   54:          apply_interval2/1,
   55:          apply_interval_invalid_args/1,
   56:          apply_repeatedly1/1,
   57:          apply_repeatedly2/1,
   58:          apply_repeatedly_invalid_args/1,
   59:          send_interval1/1,
   60:          send_interval2/1,
   61:          send_interval3/1,
   62:          send_interval4/1,
   63:          send_interval5/1,
   64:          send_interval_invalid_args/1,
   65:          cancel1/1,
   66:          cancel2/1,
   67:          cancel3/1,
   68:          cancel4/1,
   69:          cancel5/1,
   70:          cancel6/1,
   71:          cancel_invalid_args/1,
   72:          sleep1/1,
   73:          sleep2/1,
   74:          tc/1,
   75:          unexpected1/1,
   76:          unexpected2/1,
   77:          unexpected3/1,
   78:          nonexistent1/1,
   79:          nonexistent2/1,
   80:          timer_perf/1]).
   81: 
   82: %% internal
   83: -export([forever/0,
   84:          do_nrev/2,
   85:          send/2,
   86:          timer/4,
   87:          timer/5]).
   88: 
   89: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   90: 
   91: suite() ->
   92:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   93:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   94: 
   95: all() ->
   96:     [
   97:         {group, apply_after},
   98:         {group, send_after},
   99:         {group, exit_after},
  100:         {group, kill_after},
  101:         {group, apply_interval},
  102:         {group, apply_repeatedly},
  103:         {group, send_interval},
  104:         {group, cancel},
  105:         {group, sleep},
  106:         {group, misc}
  107:     ].
  108: 
  109: groups() -> 
  110:     [
  111:         {
  112:             apply_after,
  113:             [],
  114:             [
  115:                 apply_after1,
  116:                 apply_after2,
  117:                 apply_after3,
  118:                 apply_after4,
  119:                 apply_after_invalid_args
  120:             ]
  121:         },
  122:         {
  123:             send_after,
  124:             [],
  125:             [
  126:                 send_after1,
  127:                 send_after2,
  128:                 send_after3,
  129:                 send_after4,
  130:                 send_after5,
  131:                 send_after6,
  132:                 send_after7,
  133:                 send_after_invalid_args
  134:             ]
  135:         },
  136:         {
  137:             exit_after,
  138:             [],
  139:             [
  140:                 exit_after1,
  141:                 exit_after2,
  142:                 exit_after3,
  143:                 exit_after4
  144:             ]
  145:         },
  146:         {
  147:             kill_after,
  148:             [],
  149:             [
  150:                 kill_after1,
  151:                 kill_after2,
  152:                 kill_after3
  153:             ]
  154:         },
  155:         {
  156:             apply_interval,
  157:             [],
  158:             [
  159:                 apply_interval1,
  160:                 apply_interval2,
  161:                 apply_interval_invalid_args
  162:             ]
  163:         },
  164:         {
  165:             apply_repeatedly,
  166:             [],
  167:             [
  168:                 apply_repeatedly1,
  169:                 apply_repeatedly2,
  170:                 apply_repeatedly_invalid_args
  171:             ]
  172:         },
  173:         {
  174:             send_interval,
  175:             [],
  176:             [
  177:                 send_interval1,
  178:                 send_interval2,
  179:                 send_interval3,
  180:                 send_interval4,
  181:                 send_interval5,
  182:                 send_interval_invalid_args
  183:             ]
  184:         },
  185:         {
  186:             cancel,
  187:             [],
  188:             [
  189:                 cancel1,
  190:                 cancel2,
  191:                 cancel3,
  192:                 cancel4,
  193:                 cancel5,
  194:                 cancel6,
  195:                 cancel_invalid_args
  196:             ]
  197:         },
  198:         {
  199:             sleep,
  200:             [],
  201:             [
  202:                 sleep1,
  203:                 sleep2
  204:             ]
  205:         },
  206:         {
  207:             misc,
  208:             [],
  209:             [
  210:                 tc,
  211:                 unexpected1,
  212:                 unexpected2,
  213:                 unexpected3,
  214:                 nonexistent1,
  215:                 nonexistent2,
  216:                 timer_perf
  217:             ]
  218:         }
  219:     ].
  220: 
  221: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  222:     Config.
  223: 
  224: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  228:     Config.
  229: 
  230: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  231:     Config.
  232: 
  233: 
  234: init_per_testcase(_, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     ok = timer:start(),
  236:     Config.
  237: 
  238: %% Testing timer interface!!
  239: 
  240: %% Test of apply_after with time = 0, with sending of message.
  241: apply_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  242:     Msg = make_ref(),
  243:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:apply_after(0, ?MODULE, send, [self(), Msg]),
  244:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  245: 
  246: %% Test of apply_after with time = 500, with sending of message.
  247: apply_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  248:     Msg = make_ref(),
  249:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:apply_after(500, ?MODULE, send, [self(), Msg]),
  250:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  251: 
  252: %% Test that a request starts the timer server if it is not running.
  253: apply_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  255:     Msg = make_ref(),
  256:     timer:apply_after(100, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  257:     ok = get_mess(500, Msg),
  258:     {timer_server, Pid, worker, [timer]} = lists:keyfind(timer_server, 1, supervisor:which_children(kernel_sup)),
  259:     true = is_pid(Pid).
  260: 
  261: %% Test that a request starts the timer server if it is not running.
  262: apply_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  263:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  264:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  265:     Msg = make_ref(),
  266:     timer:apply_after(100, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  267:     ok = get_mess(500, Msg),
  268:     {timer_server, Pid, worker, [timer]} = lists:keyfind(timer_server, 1, supervisor:which_children(kernel_sup)),
  269:     true = is_pid(Pid).
  270: 
  271: %% Test that apply_after rejects invalid arguments.
  272: apply_after_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  273:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(-1, foo, bar, []),
  274:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, "foo", bar, []),
  275:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, "bar", []),
  276:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, bar, baz),
  277:     ok.
  278: 
  279: %% Test of send_after with time = 0.
  280: send_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  281:     Msg = make_ref(),
  282:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, Msg),
  283:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  284: 
  285: %% Test of send_after with time = 0 using a registered name.
  286: send_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  287:     Msg = make_ref(),
  288:     Name = register_name(self()),
  289:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, Name, Msg),
  290:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg),
  291:     unregister(Name).
  292: 
  293: %% Test of send_after with time = 0 using a registered name
  294: %% and node.
  295: send_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  296:     Msg = make_ref(),
  297:     Name = register_name(self()),
  298:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  299:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg),
  300:     unregister(Name).
  301: 
  302: %% Test of send_after with time = 500.
  303: send_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     Msg = make_ref(),
  305:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(500, self(), Msg),
  306:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg).
  307: 
  308: %% Test of send_after with time = 500, with receiver a registered
  309: %% process. [OTP-2735]
  310: send_after5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  311:     Msg = make_ref(),
  312:     Name = register_name(self()),
  313:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, Name, Msg),
  314:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  315:     unregister(Name).
  316: 
  317: %% Test of send_after with time = 500 using a registered process
  318: %% and node.
  319: send_after6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  320:     Msg = make_ref(),
  321:     Name = register_name(self()),
  322:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  323:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  324:     unregister(Name).
  325: 
  326: %% Test that send_after works if the destination is a registered
  327: %% name which gets registered after the timer is started.
  328: send_after7(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     Msg = make_ref(),
  330:     Name = make_name(),
  331:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, Name, Msg),
  332:     register(Name, self()),
  333:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  334:     unregister(Name).
  335: 
  336: %% Test that send_after rejects invalid arguments.
  337: send_after_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  338:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, test),
  339:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, self(), test),
  340:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, ?MODULE, test),
  341:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(0, "", test),
  342:     ok.
  343: 
  344: %% Test of exit_after with time = 1000.
  345: exit_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  346:     Msg = make_ref(),
  347:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  348:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  349:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Pid, Msg),
  350:     ok = get_mess(5000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  351: 
  352: %% Test of exit_after with time = 1000. The process to exit is the
  353: %% name of a registered process.  [OTP-2735]
  354: exit_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  355:     Msg = make_ref(),
  356:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  357:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  358:     Name = register_name(Pid),
  359:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Name, Msg),
  360:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  361: 
  362: %% Test of exit_after for sending an exit to self.
  363: exit_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  364:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  365:     Msg = make_ref(),
  366:     Pid = spawn_link(
  367:         fun () ->
  368:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Msg),
  369:             forever()
  370:         end
  371:     ),
  372:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  373: 
  374: %% Test that using exit_after to a non-existent
  375: %% process does not crash the timer server.
  376: exit_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  377:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  378:     timer:exit_after(0, make_name(), make_ref()),
  379:     receive
  380:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  381:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  382:     after 1000 ->
  383:         ok
  384:     end.
  385: 
  386: %% Test of kill_after with time = 1000.
  387: kill_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  388:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  389:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  390:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000, Pid),
  391:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  392: 
  393: %% Test of kill_after with time = 1000. The process to exit is the
  394: %% name of a registered process.  [OTP-2735]
  395: kill_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  396:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  397:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  398:     Name = register_name(Pid),
  399:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000, Name),
  400:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  401: 
  402: %% Test of kill_after for self-killing.
  403: kill_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  404:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  405:     Pid = spawn_link(
  406:         fun () ->
  407:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000),
  408:             forever()
  409:         end
  410:     ),
  411:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  412: 
  413: %% Test of apply_interval by sending messages. Receive
  414: %% 3 messages, cancel the timer, and check that we do
  415: %% not get any more messages.
  416: apply_interval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  417:     Msg = make_ref(),
  418:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_interval(1000, ?MODULE, send,
  419:                                      [self(), Msg]),
  420:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 3),
  421:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  422:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  423: 
  424: %% Test apply_interval with the execution time of the action
  425: %% longer than the timer interval. The timer should not wait for
  426: %% the action to complete, ie start another action while the
  427: %% previously started action is still running.
  428: apply_interval2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     Msg = make_ref(),
  430:     Self = self(),
  431:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_interval(500, erlang, apply,
  432:                                      [fun() ->
  433:                                           Self ! Msg,
  434:                                           receive after 1000 -> ok end
  435:                                       end, []]),
  436:     receive after 1800 -> ok end,
  437:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  438:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg, 3),
  439:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  440: 
  441: %% Test that apply_interval rejects invalid arguments.
  442: apply_interval_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  443:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(-1, foo, bar, []),
  444:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, "foo", bar, []),
  445:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, "bar", []),
  446:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, bar, baz),
  447:     ok.
  448: 
  449: %% Test of apply_repeatedly by sending messages. Receive
  450: %% 3 messages, cancel the timer, and check that we do
  451: %% not get any more messages. In a case like this, ie where
  452: %% the execution time of the action is shorter than the timer
  453: %% interval, this should behave the same as apply_interval.
  454: apply_repeatedly1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     Msg = make_ref(),
  456:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1000, ?MODULE, send,
  457:                                        [self(), Msg]),
  458:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 3),
  459:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  460:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  461: 
  462: %% Test apply_repeatedly with the execution time of the action
  463: %% longer than the timer interval. The timer should wait for
  464: %% the action to complete, ie not start another action until it
  465: %% has completed.
  466: apply_repeatedly2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  467:     Msg = make_ref(),
  468:     Self = self(),
  469:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1, erlang, apply,
  470:                                        [fun() ->
  471:                                             Self ! Msg,
  472:                                             receive after 1000 -> ok end
  473:                                         end, []]),
  474:     receive after 2500 -> ok end,
  475:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  476:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg, 3),
  477:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  478: 
  479: %% Test that apply_repeatedly rejects invalid arguments.
  480: apply_repeatedly_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  481:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(-1, foo, bar, []),
  482:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, "foo", bar, []),
  483:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, foo, "bar", []),
  484:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, foo, bar, baz),
  485:     ok.
  486: 
  487: %% Test of send_interval/2. Receive 5 messages, cancel the timer, and
  488: %% check that we do not get any more messages.
  489: send_interval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  490:     Msg = make_ref(),
  491:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, Msg),
  492:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 5),
  493:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  494:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg). % We should receive only five
  495: 
  496: %% Test of send_interval/3. Receive 2 messages, cancel the timer, and
  497: %% check that we do not get any more messages.
  498: send_interval2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  499:     Msg = make_ref(),
  500:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, self(), Msg),
  501:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  502:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  503:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).  % We should receive only two
  504: 
  505: %% Test of send_interval/3. Receive 2 messages, cancel the timer, and
  506: %% check that we do not get any more messages. The receiver is the
  507: %% name of a registered process. [OTP-2735]
  508: send_interval3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  509:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  510:     Msg = make_ref(),
  511:     Name = register_name(self()),
  512:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, Name, Msg),
  513:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  514:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  515:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg),  % We should receive only two
  516:     unregister(Name).
  517: 
  518: %% Test of send_interval/3 using a registered name and node.
  519: send_interval4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  520:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  521:     Msg = make_ref(),
  522:     Name = register_name(self()),
  523:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  524:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  525:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  526:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg), % We should receive only two
  527:     unregister(Name).
  528: 
  529: %% Test that send interval stops sending msg when the receiving
  530: %% process terminates.
  531: send_interval5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  532:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  533:     {ok, {interval, Ref}} = timer:send_interval(500, Msg1),
  534:     receive 
  535:         Msg1 -> ok
  536:     end,
  537:     timer_server ! {'DOWN', Ref, process, self(), test},
  538:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  539:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  540:     Msg2 = receive
  541:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  542:     end.
  543: 
  544: %% Test that send_interval rejects invalid arguments.
  545: send_interval_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  546:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, test),
  547:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, self(), test),
  548:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, ?MODULE, test),
  549:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(0, "", test),
  550:     ok.
  551: 
  552: %% Test that we can cancel an instant timer
  553: cancel1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  554:     Msg = make_ref(),
  555:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_after(0, Msg),
  556:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  557:     ok = get_mess(0, Msg). % We should rec 1 msg as it got sent immediately
  558: 
  559: %% Test that we can cancel a send-once timer.
  560: cancel2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  561:     Msg = make_ref(),
  562:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_after(1000, Msg),
  563:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  564:     nor = get_mess(2000, Msg). % We should rec 0 msgs
  565: 
  566: %% Test that we can cancel an apply-once timer.
  567: cancel3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  568:     Msg = make_ref(),
  569:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_after(1000, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  570:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  571:     nor = get_mess(2000, Msg).
  572: 
  573: %% Test that we can cancel a send-interval timer.
  574: cancel4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  575:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  576:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(500, Msg1),
  577:     receive
  578:         Msg1 -> ok
  579:     end,
  580:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  581:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  582:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  583:     Msg2 = receive
  584:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  585:     end.
  586: 
  587: %% Test that we can cancel an apply-interval timer.
  588: cancel5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  589:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  590:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_interval(500, erlang, send, [self(), Msg1]),
  591:     receive
  592:         Msg1 -> ok
  593:     end,
  594:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  595:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  596:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  597:     Msg2 = receive
  598:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  599:     end.
  600: 
  601: %% Test that cancelling non-existent timers does not crash the
  602: %% timer server. 
  603: cancel6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  604:     lists:foreach(
  605:         fun (TimerType) ->
  606:             Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  607: 	    {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel({TimerType, make_ref()}),
  608:             receive
  609:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  610:                     error({timer_server_crashed, {cancel, TimerType}})
  611:             after 500 ->
  612:                 ok
  613:             end,
  614: 	    demonitor(Mon)
  615:         end,
  616: 	[once, instant, interval, send_local]
  617:     ).
  618: 
  619: %% Test that cancel rejects invalid arguments.
  620: cancel_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  621:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel(no_reference),
  622:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({foo, make_ref()}),
  623:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({once, foo}),
  624:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({interval, foo}),
  625:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({instant, foo}),
  626:     ok.
  627: 
  628: %% Test that sleep pauses the calling process for
  629: %% at least the given time.
  630: sleep1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  631:     T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  632:     ok = timer:sleep(1000),
  633:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  634:     true = T1 - T0 >= 1000,
  635:     ok.
  636: 
  637: %% Test that sleep accepts times >(2^32)-1, which is
  638: %% the maximum time for the after clause of a receive
  639: %% operation, at the time of this writing.
  640: sleep2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  641:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  642:     Pid = spawn_link(
  643:         fun () ->
  644:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000),
  645:             ok = timer:sleep(16#ffffffff+1)
  646:         end
  647:     ),
  648:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  649: 
  650: %% Test that unexpected calls do not crash the timer server.
  651: unexpected1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  653:     try
  654:         gen_server:call(timer_server, foo, 100)
  655:     of
  656:         _ ->
  657:             error(timeout_expected)
  658:     catch
  659:         exit:{timeout, _} ->
  660:             ok
  661:     end,
  662:     receive
  663:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  664:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  665:     after 500 ->
  666:         ok
  667:     end,
  668:     demonitor(Mon).
  669: 
  670: %% Test that unexpected casts do not crash the timer server.
  671: unexpected2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  672:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  673:     gen_server:cast(timer_server, foo),
  674:     receive
  675:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  676:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  677:     after 500 ->
  678:         ok
  679:     end,
  680:     demonitor(Mon).
  681: 
  682: %% Test that unexpected info messages do not crash the timer server.
  683: unexpected3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  684:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  685:     timer_server ! foo,
  686:     receive
  687:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  688:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  689:     after 500 ->
  690:         ok
  691:     end,
  692:     demonitor(Mon).
  693: 
  694: %% Test that timeouts of one-shot timers the timer server does not
  695: %% know are not executed.
  696: nonexistent1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  697:     Msg = make_ref(),
  698:     timer_server ! {timeout, make_ref(), {apply_once, {erlang, send, [self(), Msg]}}},
  699:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  700: 
  701: %% Test that timeouts of interval timers the timer server does not
  702: %% know are not executed.
  703: nonexistent2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  704:     Msg = make_ref(),
  705:     timer_server ! {timeout, make_ref, {apply_interval, erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond), 1000, make_ref(), {erlang, send, [self(), Msg]}}},
  706:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  707: 
  708: %% Test sleep/1 and tc/3.
  709: tc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  710:     %% This should test both sleep and tc/3
  711:     {Res1, ok} = timer:tc(timer, sleep, [500]),
  712:     ok = if
  713:              Res1 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res1}; % Too early
  714:              Res1 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res1};  % Too much time
  715:              true -> ok
  716:          end,
  717: 
  718:     %% tc/2
  719:     {Res2, ok} = timer:tc(fun(T) -> ok = timer:sleep(T) end, [500]),
  720:     ok = if
  721:              Res2 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res2}; % Too early
  722:              Res2 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res2};  % Too much time
  723:              true -> ok
  724:          end,
  725: 
  726:     %% tc/1
  727:     {Res3, ok} = timer:tc(fun() -> ok = timer:sleep(500) end),
  728:     ok = if
  729:              Res3 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res3}; % Too early
  730:              Res3 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res3};  % Too much time
  731:              true -> ok
  732:          end,
  733: 
  734:     %% tc/4
  735:     {Res4, ok} = timer:tc(timer, sleep, [500], millisecond),
  736:     ok = if
  737:              Res4 < 500 -> {too_early, Res4};
  738:              Res4 > 800 -> {too_late, Res4};
  739:              true -> ok
  740:          end,
  741: 
  742:     %% Check that timer:tc don't catch errors
  743:     ok = try timer:tc(erlang, exit, [foo], second)
  744:          catch exit:foo -> ok
  745:          end,
  746: 
  747:     ok = try timer:tc(erlang, exit, [foo])
  748:          catch exit:foo -> ok
  749:          end,
  750: 
  751:     ok = try timer:tc(fun(Reason) -> 1 = Reason end, [foo])
  752:          catch error:{badmatch,_} -> ok
  753:          end,
  754: 
  755:     ok = try timer:tc(fun() -> throw(foo) end)
  756:          catch foo -> ok
  757:          end,
  758: 
  759:     %% Check that return values are propageted
  760:     Self = self(),
  761:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(erlang, self, [], second),
  762:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(erlang, self, []),
  763:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(fun(P) -> P end, [self()]),
  764:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(fun() -> self() end),
  765: 
  766:     Sec = timer:seconds(4),
  767:     Min = timer:minutes(4),
  768:     Hour = timer:hours(4),
  769:     MyRes = 4*1000 + 4*60*1000 + 4*60*60*1000,
  770:     if  MyRes == Sec + Min + Hour -> ok end,
  771:     TimerRes = timer:hms(4,4,4),
  772:     if MyRes == TimerRes -> ok end,
  773:     ok.
  774: 
  775: get_mess(Time, Mess) -> get_mess(Time, Mess, 1).
  776: get_mess(_, _, 0) -> ok;  % Received
  777: get_mess(Time, Mess, N) ->
  778:     receive 
  779:         Mess -> get_mess(Time, Mess, N-1)
  780:     after Time ->
  781:         nor   % Not Received
  782:     end.
  783: 
  784: forever() ->
  785:     ok = timer:sleep(1000),
  786:     forever().
  787: 
  788: 
  789: %%
  790: %% Testing for performance (on different implementations) of timers
  791: %%
  792: 
  793: 
  794: timer_perf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  795:     performance(timer).
  796: 
  797: performance(Mod) ->
  798:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),    
  799:     {Y,Mo,D} = date(),
  800:     {H,M,S} = time(),
  801:     io:format("Testing module '~p' Date: ~w/~w/~w ~w:~w:~w~n", 
  802:               [Mod,Y,Mo,D,H,M,S]),
  803:     Result = big_test(Mod),
  804:     report_result(Result).
  805: 
  806: big_test(M) ->
  807:     Load_Pids = start_nrev(20, M),   % Increase if more load wanted :)
  808: 
  809:     LPids = spawn_timers(5, M, 10000, 5),
  810: 
  811:     apply(M, sleep, [4000]),
  812:     MPids = spawn_timers(10, M, 1000, 6),
  813: 
  814:     apply(M, sleep, [3500]),
  815:     SPids = spawn_timers(15, M, 100, 3),
  816: 
  817:     Res = wait(SPids ++ MPids ++ LPids, [], 0, M),
  818: 
  819:     lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> exit(Pid, kill) end, Load_Pids),
  820:     Res.
  821: 
  822: wait([], Res, N, _) ->
  823:     {Res, N};
  824: wait(Pids, ResList, N, M) ->
  825:     receive
  826:         {Pid, ok, Res, T} ->
  827:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), [{T, Res} | ResList], N, M);
  828:         {Pid, Error}->
  829:             ct:fail(Error),
  830:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), ResList, N+1, M);
  831:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  832:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), ResList, N, M);
  833:         {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  834:             ct:fail({Pid,Reason})
  835:     end.
  836: 
  837: spawn_timers(0, _, _, _) ->
  838:     [];
  839: spawn_timers(N, M, T, NumIter) ->
  840:     apply(M, sleep, [120*N]),
  841:     Pid1 = spawn_link(?MODULE, timer, [apply, M, T, self()]),
  842:     Pid2 = spawn_link(?MODULE, timer, [interval, M, T, self(), NumIter]),
  843:     [Pid1, Pid2 | spawn_timers(N-1, M, T, NumIter)].
  844: 
  845: timer(apply, Mod, T, Pid) ->
  846:     Before = system_time(),
  847:     {ok, Ref} = apply(Mod, apply_after, [T, ?MODULE, send, [self(), done]]),
  848:     receive 
  849:         done ->
  850:             After = system_time(),
  851:             Pid ! {self(), ok, (After-Before) div 1000, T}
  852:     after T*3 + 300 ->   % Watch dog
  853:             io:format("WARNING TIMER WATCHDOG timed out: ~w ~n", [T]),
  854:             {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  855:             Pid ! {self(), watch_dog_timed_out}
  856:     end.
  857: 
  858: timer(interval, Mod, T, Pid, NumIter) ->
  859:     Before = system_time(),
  860:     {ok, Ref} = apply(Mod, apply_interval, [T, ?MODULE, send, [self(), done]]),
  861:     timer_irec(Before, T, {0, NumIter}, [], {Pid, Mod, Ref}).
  862: 
  863: timer_irec(_Start, T, {N, N}, Res, {Pid, Mod, Ref}) ->
  864:     apply(Mod, cancel, [Ref]),
  865:     Min = lists:min(Res),
  866:     Max = lists:max(Res),
  867:     Tot = lists:sum(Res),
  868:     Pid ! {self(), ok, {N, Tot, Tot div N, Min, Max}, T};
  869: timer_irec(Start, T, {N, Max}, Res, {Pid, Mod, Ref}) ->
  870:     receive
  871:         done ->
  872:             Now = system_time(),
  873:             Elapsed = (Now - (Start + (N*T*1000))) div 1000,
  874:             timer_irec(Start, T,
  875:                        {N+1, Max},
  876:                        [Elapsed | Res],
  877:                        {Pid, Mod, Ref})
  878:     after T*3 + 300 ->
  879:             apply(Mod, cancel, [Ref]),
  880:             io:format("WARNING: TIMER WATCHDOG timed out <Interval>~w~n",[T]),
  881:             Pid ! {self(), timer_watchdog_timed_out_in_interlval_test}  
  882:     end.
  883: 
  884: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  885: %%  Small last generator
  886: 
  887: start_nrev(0, _) ->
  888:     [];
  889: 
  890: start_nrev(N, M) ->
  891:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, do_nrev, [N, M]),
  892:     [Pid | start_nrev(N-1, M)].
  893: 
  894: do_nrev(Sleep, Mod) ->
  895:     apply(Mod, sleep, [50 * Sleep]),
  896:     test(1000,"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz1234"),
  897:     ok.
  898: 
  899: test(0,_) ->
  900:     true;
  901: test(N,L) ->
  902:     nrev(L),
  903:     test(N - 1, L).
  904: 
  905: nrev([]) ->
  906:     [];
  907: nrev([H|T]) ->
  908:     append(nrev(T), [H]).
  909: 
  910: append([H|T],Z) ->
  911:     [H|append(T,Z)];
  912: append([],X) ->
  913:     X.
  914: 
  915: system_time() ->    
  916:     erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond).
  917: 
  918: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  919: 
  920: report_result({Res, 0}) ->
  921:     {A_List, I_List} = split_list(Res, [], []),
  922:     A_val = calc_a_val(A_List),
  923:     I_val = calc_i_val(I_List),
  924:     print_report(A_val, I_val),
  925:     ok;
  926: 
  927: report_result({Head, N}) ->
  928:     io:format("Test Failed: Number of internal tmo ~w~n", [N]),
  929:     ct:fail({Head, N}).
  930: 
  931: split_list([], AL, IL) ->
  932:     {AL, IL};
  933: split_list([{T, {N, Tot, A, Min, Max}} | Rest], AL, IL) ->
  934:     split_list(Rest, AL, [{T, {N, Tot, A, Min, Max}} | IL]);
  935: split_list([Head | Rest], AL, IL) ->
  936:     split_list(Rest, [Head | AL], IL).
  937: 
  938: split([{T, Res} | R]) ->
  939:     split(R, {{T,[Res]}, {T*10,[]}, {T*100,[]}}).
  940: 
  941: split([{T, Res} | R], {{T,S}, M, L}) ->
  942:     split(R, {{T,[Res|S]}, M, L});
  943: 
  944: split([{T, Res} | R], {S, {T,M}, L}) ->
  945:     split(R, {S, {T, [Res|M]}, L});
  946: 
  947: split([{T, Res} | R], {S, M, {T,L}}) ->
  948:     split(R, {S, M, {T, [Res|L]}});
  949: 
  950: split(_Done, Vals) ->
  951:     Vals.
  952: 
  953: calc_a_val(List) ->
  954:     New = lists:sort(List),
  955:     {{T1, S}, {T2, M}, {T3, L}} = split(New),
  956:     S2 = {length(S), lists:max(S), lists:min(S), 
  957:           lists:sum(S) div length(S)},
  958:     M2 = {length(M), lists:max(M), lists:min(M), 
  959:           lists:sum(M) div length(M)},
  960:     L2 = {length(L), lists:max(L), lists:min(L), 
  961:           lists:sum(L) div length(L)},
  962:     [{T1, S2}, {T2, M2}, {T3, L2}].
  963: 
  964: calc_i_val(List) ->
  965:     New =  lists:sort(List),
  966:     {{T1, S}, {T2, M}, {T3, L}} = split(New),
  967:     S2 = get_ivals(S),
  968:     M2 = get_ivals(M),
  969:     L2 = get_ivals(L),
  970:     [{T1, S2}, {T2, M2}, {T3, L2}].
  971: 
  972: get_ivals(List) ->
  973:     Len = length(List),
  974:     Num = element(1, hd(List)), % Number of iterations
  975: 
  976:     LTot = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(2, X) end, List),
  977:     LMin = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(4, X) end, List),
  978:     LMax = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(5, X) end, List),
  979: 
  980:     MaxTot  = lists:max(LTot),
  981:     MinTot  = lists:min(LTot),
  982:     AverTot = lists:sum(LTot) div Len,
  983: 
  984:     IterMax = lists:max(LMax),
  985:     IterMin = lists:min(LMin),
  986:     IterAver= AverTot div Num,
  987: 
  988:     {Len, Num,
  989:      {MaxTot, MinTot, AverTot}, 
  990:      {IterMax, IterMin, IterAver}}.
  991: 
  992: 
  993: print_report(A_L, I_L) ->
  994:     io:format("~nRESULTS from timer test~n~n",[]),
  995:     io:format("Time out times for send_after~n~n", []),
  996:     io:format("Time No of tests  Max    Min  Average~n",[]),
  997:     print_aval(A_L),
  998:     io:format("Time out times for send_interval~n~n", []),
  999:     io:format("Time No.tests  No.intvals TotMax TotMin TotAver  MaxI   MinI  AverI~n", []),
 1000:     print_ival(I_L).
 1001: 
 1002: print_aval([]) ->
 1003:     io:format("~n~n", []);
 1004: print_aval([{T, {L, Max, Min, Aver}}|R]) ->
 1005:     io:format("~5w ~8w ~6w ~6w ~8w ~n", 
 1006:               [T,L,Max,Min,Aver]),
 1007:     print_aval(R).
 1008: 
 1009: print_ival([]) ->
 1010:     io:format("~n", []);
 1011: print_ival([{T, {Len, Num, 
 1012:                  {MaxT, MinT, AverT},
 1013:                  {MaxI, MinI, AverI}}}|R]) ->
 1014:     io:format("~5w ~6w ~10w ~8w ~6w ~6w ~6w ~6w ~6w~n", 
 1015:               [T,Len,Num,MaxT,MinT,AverT, MaxI, MinI, AverI]),
 1016:     print_ival(R).
 1017: 
 1018: send(Pid, Msg) ->
 1019:     Pid ! Msg.
 1020: 
 1021: %% Create a unique name and register it to the given process.
 1022: register_name(Pid) ->
 1023:     Name = make_name(),
 1024:     register(Name, Pid),
 1025:     Name.
 1026: 
 1027: %% Create a unique name.
 1028: make_name() ->
 1029:     list_to_atom(ref_to_list(make_ref())).
